summary: This document is an email chain from August 13-15, 2019, regarding a planned visit by U.S. Attorney Geoffrey Berman and other DOJ officials to the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) in New York. The visit was to inspect specific areas, including the suicide watch area and Jeffrey Epstein's cell, which was still cordoned off following his death. The emails coordinate logistics and emphasize that only MCC legal staff should escort the visitors due to ongoing investigations.

persons.name: Geoffrey Berman
persons.context: U.S. Attorney for the Southern District of New York who is organizing a visit to the MCC to inspect areas including Epstein's cell. He is a key visitor in the email chain.

persons.name: Ed O'Callahan
persons.context: Principal Deputy Attorney General who is part of the DOJ group visiting the MCC. He is mentioned as being walked over to meet with the Regional Director and new Warden.

persons.name: Donaleski
persons.context: Assistant U.S. Attorney for the Southern District of New York who sends the initial request detailing the areas to be visited, including Epstein's cell, and specifies that only MCC legal should escort the group.

connections.description: Both are high-ranking DOJ officials coordinating a joint visit to the MCC following Epstein's death.
Donaleski is an Assistant U.S. Attorney working under or with U.S. Attorney Geoffrey Berman, as he is organizing the visit details on Berman's behalf.

events.title: DOJ Visit to MCC
events.description: A visit by U.S. Attorney Geoffrey Berman, Principal Deputy AG Ed O'Callahan, and other DOJ staff to the Metropolitan Correctional Center to inspect the suicide watch area, SHU, and Epstein's cordoned-off cell.

locations: New York Metropolitan Correctional Center, 150 Park Row, New York, New York 10007
keyFacts: The visit was scheduled for August 15, 2019, just days after Jeffrey Epstein's death in the MCC on August 10, 2019.
The specific purpose was to inspect the 2nd floor psych observation/suicide watch area, the 9th floor SHU, and Epstein's cell, which was noted as still being cordoned off.
The request specified that only MCC legal staff should escort the visitors, and they would not speak to any guards present due to ongoing investigations.
The email chain shows coordination between the U.S. Attorney's Office (SDNY) and MCC staff, indicating a high-level DOJ interest in the conditions surrounding Epstein's death.
